body_content.explanation: the position of lieutenant (= an officer of middle rank in the armed forces), or the period when someone holds this position:
examples: He won a lieutenancy by sheer bravery in the field.
A lieutenancy in the Guards from 1943 was followed by time in the diplomatic corps.
An attack was mounted on the duchy of Aquitaine, but the day was saved by the able lieutenancy of Richard of Cornwall.

body_content.explanation: lieutenants (= officers of middle rank in the armed forces) considered as a group:
examples: There have been occasional attempts to infiltrate a new type of person into the ranks of the lieutenancy.
